Case reference: 2015017939.CaseDesc: On November 10, 1998, the body of a man was discovered in a container shipped by the "Cast" Company, which was being stored in the Port of Montreal. The individual had taken refuge, with food, in the shipping container which had arrived in Montreal by boat (the "Canmar Valour") from Livorno, Italy.

Shoes: Brown, "Vera Gomma Italie" brand shoes, with laces. Inscribed "TAOS"
Belt: Dark patterned belt with a silver coloured buckle
Socks: Grey, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, With holes
White, Blue, With dark blue and light blue lines.
Leggings: Cotton, Black, White, Adidas boxers with white lignes.

Case reference: 2014005105.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2001, at approximately 8:00 p.m., Younes Taleb was seen for the last time at his mother’s business in Toronto, Ontario.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the right cheek

Case reference: 2006009199.CaseDesc: On July 09, 2003, Michael Linklater, his father and brother went to the Linklater family hunting & fishing camp; located near mile marker 115 on ONR Railroad line, between Cochrane and Moosonee. Mr. Linklater left the camp at about 6:00 a.m. on July 13, 2003, and has not been seen since. His father and brother searched for hours before going to mile marker 126 and calling the police. An extensive search in the area has failed to locate Mr. Linklater.

Case reference: 2014006318.CaseDesc: On November 18, 2013, it is believed that Stewart Ward travelled from Brampton to Niagara Falls, Ontario.  Stewart's vehicle was later located in a parking lot near the Falls.  Stewart has not been seen or heard from.

Case reference: 2021047301.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2001, Margarito Perez-Hernandez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018054173.CaseDesc: On September 23, 2018, at approximately 11:00am, Melvin Hillier was last seen at his home in Torbay, Newfoundland. Mr. Hillier had advised his family that he was going for a drive. Melvin’s blue pick-up truck was later located abandoned on the MV Legionnaire (one of the ferries that operates between Portugal Cove-St. Phillips and Bell Island, Newfoundland). Surveillance footage of the ferry shows Melvin walking around the lounge area during 1:45pm crossing. He was last observed on video between 1:50pm and 1:57pm.

Case reference: 2010004199.CaseDesc: Kalon Purvis had been living and working in the Minden area since early May 2008.  He had been involved in a car accident on June 19, 2008 resulting in him needing to use a rental car.  The small red rental car was returned sometime in July.  Mr. Purvis was last seen in July 2008 when he was dropped off in the area of the Home Hardware store in Minden to meet someone he was going to do some work for, for two weeks.  Mr. Purvis would have had a large male dog (Rottweiler) named Magnum with him around the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Black, Wavy, Medium length and parted in the middle
Tattoo: Abdomen, Incomplete graphic of horse heads

Case reference: 2006013599.CaseDesc: Donald Taylor has been missing from South Porcupine, Ontario since August 24, 1989 at 7:00 in the morning and has not been seen since.

Boots: Leather, Tan, "Kodiak" Steel toe work boots

Case reference: 2016068490.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1971, Mr. Georges Turcotte went missing from the Saint-Hyacinthe, Quebec area. Georges was last seen at his home with his wife.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Snake or zig zag

Case reference: 2014006231.CaseDesc: Luis Rodrigues was visiting Canada on a student visa. He was despondent over failing his classes and his visa being expired.

Case reference: 2014004294.CaseDesc: On May 28, 2001, Jean-Paul Leroux was seen for the last time when he left his spouse’s residence in Montreal, Quebec.  His vehicle was located abandoned 7 days later in the parking lot of the Saint-Leonard shopping centre. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003305.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1987, Wade Stanley Saxton was seen for the last time as he left his residence in St. Catharines, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004024.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1989, Ernestine Kasyon was seen for the last time while leaving a residence to use a payphone in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014001067.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1993, the body of an unidentified elderly woman was found in the Fraser River, upstream from the city of New Westminster, British-Columbia. She wore a single octagonal silver ring on her left hand and had full dentures.

Ring: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Third finger on left hand, octagonal shape

Case reference: 2014004359.CaseDesc: On July 20, 2003, Stephane Gallant was last seen at the Shoreline Hotel in Thunder Bay, Ontario.  Stephane speaks French and English with a French accent.  Stephane worked in the logging industry as a woodcutter. On July 23, 2003, his vehicle, a 1984 GMC S10 blue pickup with a black topper, was located at the Trowbridge Falls campsite on Copenhagen Road in Thunder Bay, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006021799.CaseDesc: Leo Payash, aged 8, was last seen on July 01, 1957. He and his mother Cecilia Payash, aged 48 years, were walking on Red Lake Road and neither has been seen since.

Deformity: Nose, Described as having a "hooked" nose

Case reference: 2016065867.CaseDesc:
On May 1, 1976 the skeletal remains of a male, were located in area of heavy bush north of Hwy 17 (0.5 miles east of Hodder Avenue on the Lakehead Expressway near a scenic lookout), Thunder Bay.
Police reports approximate the height of the deceased to be 5'8", however, no anthropological analysis was carried out on the long bones so this value is merely a non-scientific estimate. It is believed that he died approximately 10 months to 5 years prior to discovery.

Hair: Brown, Long, Tied back with elastic fasteners with plastic balls
Teeth: Complete acrylic upper denture. Several molars & premolars extracted from lower jaw. Many remaining teeth show signs of decay
Other: Paper matches with the zodiac theme "the moon" on them
Shirt: Grey or off-white sweatshirt with a crew neck collar
Belt: Leather, Brown, 37" from the hole used to the tongue of the buckle

Case reference: 2005003499.CaseDesc: On July 22, 2002, a Caucasian male, was found in the Niagara River, near the Queenston Dock in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 187 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix is present. He may have been a smoker. He was likely in the water for a few days at most.

Hair: Brown, Shorter than collar length, receding hair line
Teeth: He has natural teeth with some amalgam and composite resin restorations

Case reference: 2016061229.CaseDesc: On August 7, 1973, a male individual was found on the GO Train tracks near Roncesvalles and the Gardiner, beneath the Sunnyside Walkway, from which he apparently fell/jumped. His post-mortem length was 5’5"-5’8", but due to extensive bone fractures this may not accurately reflect his height. His appendix was not present.

Hair: Short, Straight, Dark, straight hair approximately 2-3" in length
Shirt: Grey, Patterned, may have been blue and white

Case reference: 2012020058.CaseDesc: Roger Keesick has been missing since May of 1986.  He is very handy with woodworking and renovating.  He is also known to associate with a lot of street people.  Mr. Keesick last told his family that he was going to work at a fishing lodge outside of Winnipeg.  It was later discovered that he had never made it there.

Scar: Report only indicates "body scars"; no location indicated

Case reference: 2016013490.CaseDesc: On March 15, 2016, Ravishankar Vallepuram was seen for the last time at his residence in Scarborough, Ontario. Ravishankar has never gone missing in the past, nor has he spent the night away from his residence.

Case reference: 2012020645.CaseDesc: Peter Mckay was playing on the ice along the South Saskatchewan River in the Riversdale area of Saskatoon, SK in the late afternoon hours of December 31, 1986. Peter subsequently fell into an open portion of the river and was never found.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Orange, with a yellow stripe on the cuff

Case reference: 2014006098.CaseDesc: On March 12, 2012, Mr. Ménard left Quebec to travel to Mexico by car with his dog. When returning home on March 14, 2013, he was denied entry to the United States at the US Customs in Nuevo Laredo because his dog was carrying ticks. Therefore, he stayed in Mexico and has not been seen since. His vehicle and his dog were recovered after having been stolen. The individuals interviewed for the vehicle theft provided no information into Mr. Ménard's disappearance.

Case reference: 2016041786.CaseDesc: LeRoi La France was reported missing on March 31, 2016 when LeRoi’s siblings learned that a formal missing person report had never been made regarding their brother. He was last seen in October or November of 1964. In 1964 LeRoi was a student at UBC who lived in Burnaby BC and insured a 1952 VW Beetle.

Case reference: 2014002701.CaseDesc: On November 25, 1986, Carol Bigtobacco was reported missing to the RCMP. She was 8 years old when she was last seen 3 years earlier on March 19, 1983. It is believed she had wandered off from the family residence on Siksika Nation. She may have suffered from a disability.

Boots: One boot was found, unknown colour

Case reference: 2014001197.CaseDesc: On March 30, 2004, a motorist travelling on Hwy 21 at Content Bridge noticed human remains in the Red Deer River. Stettler RCMP were contacted and the remains were brought to shore a short time later. The body was badly decomposed but had some clothing attached and there appeared to be a tattoo on the body’s right arm.

Case reference: 2017045193.CaseDesc: On July 18, 2017, Walter Allan left his residence to attend a coin collecting conference in Montreal, Quebec.  Walter did not attend the conference and on July 21, 2017, was last seen on security footage near Iberville, Quebec. Walter's vehicle was later located on August 24, 2017, in a field near Saint-Barthelemy, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005735.CaseDesc: On December 24, 1998, Rostyslav Korolko was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance, Rostyslav was living with his brother and he had told him that he was going to look for work.

Case reference: 2013000061.CaseDesc: In 1996, Amanda Bartlett was living in Winnipeg, having previously resided in both Saskatoon and The Pas. Amanda was last seen by a family member at the intersection of Selkirk Ave. and Salter St. in late July, 1996. Amanda has not been seen or heard from since that time.

Case reference: 2014004925.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2007, Michael Bailey was last seen by the Thunder Bay Police on Bowlker Road in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Michael is known to travel on foot, and avoided being around people. During the time of his disappearance, he was living a transient lifestyle, and camped in wooded areas.

Shoes: White, Orange, RUNNERS, Running shoes in the colours white, orange and navy blue
Sweater: Blue, HOODIE, Hooded sweater in the colour navy blue
Jacket: Cotton, Grey, Blue, BUSH, Flannel jacket in the colours grey, blue, beige and brown

Case reference: 2014003916.CaseDesc: Pierrette Bouffard was last seen on January 9, 1997, in Saint-Romuald, Quebec, as she was heading to her room in the home she was living in.

Case reference: 2012020081.CaseDesc: Emily Osmond (Laplante) lived a reclusive lifestyle on a small acreage on the Northern edge of Kawacatoose First Nation. Emily seldom had contact with her family or friends and the last known contact with them was August 29, 2007. She was last seen on the 9th of September, 2007, by her hired helper. Her disappearance is very unusual. Her vehicle and personal belongings including medication were left at her residence. She also had dogs at her acreage that she cared for that were left unattended. Searches of the area have failed to locate any sign of Emily.

Case reference: 2006026599.CaseDesc: On August 1, 1995, William Reed left his residence and left a note saying he was going fishing. His truck was located parked near Gibson Mill Road, Phelps Township, with the keys and his wallet inside.

Hat: Green, cap with white lettering on the front

Case reference: 2006005399.CaseDesc: In October 1956, Charles Ombash and his brother Tom Ombash left the Pelican Falls Residential School. They had planned to canoe back to Cat Lake, or alternately take the train to Savant Lake, get a ride to Pickle Lake, and then canoe to Cat Lake. Their family has not seen them since.

Case reference: 2016068701.CaseDesc: On June 9, 1968, a male was recovered from the Detroit River just below Fighting Island, Amherstburg, Anderdon Township. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is believed that he had been in the water for several months prior to recovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Several teeth were missing. The remaining teeth had amalgam or porcelain fillings.
Shirt: Brown, checkered sport shirt; button-front and long-sleeved

Case reference: 2013000033.CaseDesc: Bernard Deromer was last seen at the metro station Berri UQAM on June 5, 1982. He is blind and walks with a white cane. He may have been approached by a religious sect.

Teeth: Other, upper front tooth obliquely broken
Scar: Right Ear, near the right ear
Other: blind and walks with a white cane

Case reference: 2017055687.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2017, Ryan Mead was seen for the last time leaving his family residence in Brampton, Ontario to travel to British Columbia. Mr. Mead purchased camping equipment in Medicine Hat, Alberta in May of 2017. Some of his possessions were recovered along the South Saskatchewan River in late May.

Case reference: 2014005108.CaseDesc: On May 20, 2008, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Zhebglin Park was seen for the last time at his home in the Tom Clove Villa Residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015011633.CaseDesc: On May 18, 2000, a man's body was recovered in the middle of the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in Pointe-aux-Trembles. According to experts, the body was not in the water for a long time.

Sweater: Cotton, White, T-shirt with "Le ciel peut attendre" written on the front and "CPA-VIH" written on the back

Case reference: 2013000042.CaseDesc: On August 8, 1999, Mary Smith was seen for the last time as she checked herself out of the Selkirk Mental Health Centre in Selkirk, Manitoba. Prior to her disappearance, Mary had received medical treatment, for head injuries, at the Health Sciences Center in Winnipeg. It is out of character for Mary, a mother of four, to not contact her family.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Flower- orchid or poinsettia

Case reference: 2018033880.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2005, Quang Le was seen for the last time by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006016699.CaseDesc: Michael Gadke and Morris Werenko were last seen in around Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, and were last heard from as they were circling over Goulais Bay in a Cessna C-172 aircraft. The Cessna C-172, had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red.

Case reference: 2014002754.CaseDesc: On November 3rd, 1963, Charles Williams was seen operating a 12' outboard motorboat in coastal waters and did not return home.

Case reference: 2012020175.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from the south arm of the Fraser River off No. 4 and Garden City Road.

Teeth: Visible Missing, No dental work done; all molars missing
Socks: Wool, Grey, work type wool socks

Case reference: 2014002353.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1978, two men found a racing canoe and reported the incident to police. During the resulting investigation it was discovered there were two men in the canoe who apparently were going out to dig for Seneca root. According to witnesses who observed the men leave; indicated they left in adverse weather conditions which included high winds. Mr. Buck has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2012020134.CaseDesc: On the morning of September 4, 2002, Edward Taylor left his residence and took his vehicle to go to work. He has not been seen since. His car was found on September 7, 2002 in a service area of Porte-du-Nord, which is located on the Laurentides highway between Saint-Jérôme and Saint-Sauveur in Quebec.

Shirt: Dark Blue, Long sleeve shirt, navy blue

Case reference: 2014004988.CaseDesc: Margaret Blackbird was last seen in Loon Lake, Saskatchewan in 1951. It had been suspected that Ms. Blackbird left for either Alberta or British Columbia; however, she made no further contact with her family. Inquiries to locate Ms. Blackbird in Alberta and British Columbia have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2014001225.CaseDesc: On November 6, 1971, the body of a young adult man was found at the Broadway Hotel Bar (now the Sunrise Hotel) on Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had recently had cranial surgery for a head injury, wore upper partial denture and went by the name “John”.

Case reference: 2006000299.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1989, an unidentified man collapsed on the sidewalk on Yonge Street, south of Front Street in Toronto, Ontario. The man was taken to St. Michael's Hospital, where he did not regain consciousness and subsequently died.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Dark, bushy eyebrows, several days growth of a beard
Scar: Evidence of previous brain surgery (right-sided craniotomy).

Case reference: 2006011899.CaseDesc: Mr. McKay was last seen outside "Clarkes Tavern" in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on December 22, 1987.

Case reference: 2014003731.CaseDesc: On October 30, 1964 at 1:00 p.m. Murray Hansen left Berens River, Manitoba to go to Black River to deliver some items to a family member. At approximately 3:00 p.m. that day it started to storm and the water on the lake became rough. Mr. Hansen planned to stay in Black River overnight and then return to Berens River. When 5 days passed and he hadn't returned home, his wife began to look for him and discovered that he had never arrived in Black River. On November 3, 1964, Mr. Hansen's boat was found turned over near Bigstone Point and was approximately 100 yards from the shore. Searches were done by air, land and boat but the body of Mr. Hansen was never recovered. Murray Hansen is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014003808.CaseDesc: On June 10, 1979, Edward McMichael was seen for the last time when he was staying at the YMCA in downtown Vancouver, British-Columbia. He previously travelled to the Yukon and Alberta and worked in the mining industry.

Case reference: 2012020660.CaseDesc: Hamza Alsharief has not been heard from by friends or family members since December 14, 2011. Originally from Saudi Arabia, Mr. Alsharief is a student studying at the University of Saskatchewan. While foul play is not suspected at this time, family members say it is unusual that he has had no contact with them.

Hair: Brown, Short, Short to medium length
Mark: Lower Lip, Small growth of facial hair

Case reference: 2019061160.CaseDesc: The body of this young to middle-aged male was found in September 2019 near Merritt, British Columbia. He had brown hair, a muscular build and no obvious scars or tattoos. The RCMP are investigating this as a suspicious death.

Sweater: Cloth, Brown, “Brunella Gori” brand with hood

Case reference: 2014001222.CaseDesc: On June 5, 1977, an unidentified man was found on the shore of Sasamat Lake in British Columbia. He had a moustache, long sideburns, and wore several unique pieces of jewelry. He would be approximately 70 years old today.

Case reference: 2013000094.CaseDesc: Robert Beauchamp was last seen in Montreal on June 22, 1993. He left his home with friends and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2014001575.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1983, Samuel Amos Quatell was reported missing from the fishing vessel “ISE II”, near Steep Island, BC. Steep Island is located near Seymour Narrows; between Quadra Island and Campbell River, BC. Samuel was last seen near the rear of the vessel, by the ship’s crew.  An extensive search failed to locate Samuel. The tidal currents near the island are extremely strong and any person in the water could travel a great distance in a short period of time.

Amputation: Left Hand, Missing tip of ring finger

Case reference: 2008016999.CaseDesc: Meryl Newcombe and George Weeden were last seen and reported missing to the White River OPP on October 29, 1959. The two men had been at a lodge operated by Mr. Newcombe at Mile 107 of the CPR line, west of Chapleau, Ontario. Mr. Weeden and Mr. Newcombe had planned a hunting trip and both were last seen between mile marker 106 and 107 of the CPR line southeast of White River and west of Chapleau. A large-scale search was conducted at the time, and again in the following spring (1960).  The search failed to locate the two men, and to date, they have not been located. Mr. Weeden exact date of birth is not known, but his year of birth is understood to be 1896 or 1897.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Leg, injured in a train wreck in 1941

Case reference: 2016066831.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1971, an autopsy was performed on the unidentified remains of a male. The exact location where the deceased was found is unknown at this point, but is in the Windsor area. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was uncircumsized. He is believed to have been dead for a few days to a few weeks.

Teeth: Four front upper incisors had been filled with gold amalgam.

Case reference: 2014002023.CaseDesc: Lara Brown was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in September 1998.  Lara was last heard from by a friend at the end of August 1998.

Case reference: 2013000003.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2011, James "Jamie" Lee was camping with several friends at the Smoky Flats Campground. Jamie was last seen by friends during the early morning hours when he went for a walk by himself.

Case reference: 2013000041.CaseDesc: David Luborksy was reported missing on the 4th of November 2010. Mr. Luborksy was last seen leaving the Parklane Residence which is situated at 1095 Merivale Road, in the City of Ottawa.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Irishman holding a beer
Right Side Of Neck, Clover leaf

Case reference: 2008011099.CaseDesc: Michael Hart left the Langton area to look for work in Western Canada as a skilled tradesman. He had maintained contact with his parents by telephone and through his banking. His parents are worried as they have had no contact with him since May 24, 1996.

Case reference: 2006024499.CaseDesc: Allan MacKenzie was last seen in Chapleau, Ontario on November 5, 1987. He was making a delivery with his red and green tractor/trailer to the Ministry of Natural Resources in Chapleau and then believed to be enroute to Toronto, Ontario. He was subsequently reported overdue in Toronto and has not been seen since. His trailer and tractor were located, parked north of Sultan, ON.

Case reference: 2016050062.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2016, Jami Springer was last seen in Moncton, New Brunswick.  Since then, no one has heard or seen Jami, and the police consider her disappearance as suspicious.

Case reference: 2014005984.CaseDesc: In 1972, Patricia Salamandyk was seen for the last time as she got off of the school bus with her sister in Spruce Grove, Parkland County, in Alberta. Patricia had told her sister that she was not going to school that day, and she has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006022599.CaseDesc: Edwin Scherer was last seen while on a hunting trip at Cedar Point Lodge on Gordon Lake. He was on vacation at the time and was a resident of Wisconsin, U.S.A.

Shirt: Wool, White, Black, lumberjack style; dirty
Jewelry: Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, watch with 3 black stones
Gold, Blue, Ring, large blue stone
Vest: Brown, Orange, hunting vest with orange on the shoulders

Case reference: 2019028156.CaseDesc: On May 24, 2019, Tyler McMichael was seen for the last time riding his bicycle at the intersection of Commissioners Road East and Wellington Road in London, Ontario. It is believed that Tyler was heading to the Chatham area.

Case reference: 2013000120.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of June 30, 2002, Lisa Marie Young was seen for the last time in Nanaimo, British Columba. On the night of June 29, Lisa travelled to a local bar, and met with some acquaintances. Lisa and her acquaintances accepted a ride from a man to an afterparty. Subsequently, Lisa left with this male driver to get some food, but communicated to her acquaintances that she would be returning to them via taxi. She has not been seen or heard from since. Based on investigational information, the Nanaimo RCMP Serious Crime Unit believes that she may have been met with foul play. Police request that anyone with information contact them directly.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Hoop necklace with medallion
Tattoo: Right Arm, Band of flowers with heart

Case reference: 2014004727.CaseDesc: Roger Belanger was last seen in May of 1984, in the Peace River, Alberta area.

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018063450.CaseDesc: On July 30, 2003, at approximately 8:30am, William King was seen for the last time when he left his seniors residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2014002600.CaseDesc: On April 10th, 1976, at approximately 3:00 am, a snowmobile carrying two adults and a young child, went through harbor ice at North West River, Newfoundland and Labrador. The young child, Stella Mary Rich, was swept under the ice after falling off the snowmobile when it struck a soft spot in the ice. Her body has never been located and it is presumed she drowned.

Case reference: 2015011629.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2013 a man was found in the waters of the St. Lawrence River on the banks of the Bellerive Park. He had a new cigarette pack, still packed in his right pocket of his coat. The man wore his watch on the left wrist. A backpack was found near the body in which there were clothes and an English book by JJR Tolkien "The Lord of the Rings".

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Milano brand watch
Shirt: Cotton, Dark Blue, Red, checkered; size XXL; written "Street Legal"
Hat: Black, Nascar racing cap written "Dupont Motor Sport" on top
Coat: Black, President Stone with a hoodie; size XL
Boots: Leather, Black, Dakota working boots; size 10; yellow sole

Case reference: 2014041781.CaseDesc: William Leslie has not been seen or heard from by anyone, including his family, since September, 1993. Mr. Leslie's belongings were found in a remote area. He had been staying in a tent in the bush Southeast of Beaverlodge in Alberta. It appeared the tent was pitched in the fall of 1993. His belongings were located under 2-3 feet of snow, along with his truck and bicycle. A jean jacket and leather jacket were located in the truck.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Short on top and long in back
Tattoo: Left Arm, "live your own life" in a ribbon

Case reference: 2021008284.CaseDesc: On December 29, 2020, this young to middle-aged Caucasian woman died in a car accident on Trans-Canada Highway 1 near Chilliwack, BC. She wore blue nail polish and had no tattoos on her lower back, abdomen or legs. She had an upper denture and her lower teeth were in poor condition.

Case reference: 2020001463.CaseDesc: On August 24, 2018, Sharon Gronfeldt was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008005899.CaseDesc: On December 30, 1965, George Angeconeb left Red Lake on foot with plans to walk to Trout Lake.  He left during a severe snowstorm carrying a record player.  He was last seen at MacDowell Lake, First Nation Territory, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006329.CaseDesc: On November 22, 2013, David Czerman was taken to Surrey Memorial Hospital for substance impairment.  Later that day, David discharged himself from the hospital and was given a bus ticket at approximately 19:40 hours. He has not been seen by his neighbours or family since November 21, 2013.  David Czerman was depressed and on pain medication for a medical condition.  Family described Mr. Czerman as a recluse, with no friends and only left his residence to go to the local pharmacy as he had trouble walking.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Dragon, Rose, bones skull
Left Forearm, Smurf, eagle, worm, heart
Right Forearm, Wizard, devil, rose, bird

Case reference: 2013000093.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1989, Arlene Gagne was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Arlene told her husband that she wanted to stay home for the day. When her husband came back, Arlene was not home. All of her personal belongings were left at home.

Case reference: 2013000096.CaseDesc: On May 6, 1972 a four man fishing and trapping team was returning from Lynn Lake on dog sleds after purchasing supplies. Mr. Bonner and his friend were in the lead sled. The team that was traveling with them was approximately 2.5 km behind. When approximately 183 metres from Mr. Bonner's sled, they noticed both men had gone through the ice. Once on scene both men had disappeared beneath the water. One of the men was pulled from the water but could not be revived. Mr. Bonner never resurfaced and despite dragging operations he could not be located.

Case reference: 2006014699.CaseDesc: On September 28, 1996, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Melanie Ethier was seen for the last time as she left a friend’s residence to walk to her residence in New Liskeard, Ontario. The distance between her home and her friend’s residence was a kilometre, but Melanie never arrived home. Foul play is suspected.

Shirt: Cotton, White, a blue heart ("Pepe" logo) t-shirt

Case reference: 2008007698.CaseDesc: John McColl left a note at his parent's home on January 27, 1979 stating that he was travelling to Nassau, Bahamas via the United States. He is known to have visited with friends in London, Ontario at the beginning of December, 1979.  Also, he purchased an airline ticket on December 14, 1979 in San Francisco. Family had noted that Mr. McColl was depressed at the time.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Middle Finger, previous break from injury/trauma

Case reference: 2014005890.CaseDesc: On February 15, 2012, Marie Antoinette Carlson was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Marie has been known to travel to Calgary, Alberta and Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2021037680.CaseDesc: Augustine Moloi went missing from Calgary, Alberta, in October 2008. Augustine's family has not seen or heard from him since this time.

Case reference: 2006005299.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1970, Joseph Valem and two friends went fishing in a 16 foot fibreglass boat. Their boat sank on Georgian Bay, near Giants Tomb Island.  Mr. Valem is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2013000115.CaseDesc: Gaby Luonga Kombe was last seen on August 23, 1999, in Montreal, Quebec. He had to go to Pie-IX metro station to meet a friend. Later in the evening, he called his son to tell him he was heading home. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020079.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1991, Lavina Tocher, 35 years old, was last seen in Parkman, SK. On the 12th of December of that year, Ms. Tocher was reported missing by an anonymous caller. Investigation and searches have failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2019050955.CaseDesc: On July 18, 2019 the remains of an unidentified man were discovered at 901 King Street West in Toronto, Ontario.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Torso (Front), Healed clavicle and rib fractures

Case reference: 2013000047.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2000, Gianfranco Ferrara was for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. He had an appointment in the east end of Montreal but he never showed up.

Case reference: 2017068602.CaseDesc: On August 13, 2017, Martin Bertram McLearn was seen for the last time. He has moderate dementia and was reported missing from his home.

Boots: Rubber, Size 7; old, worn and cracked

Case reference: 2014004910.CaseDesc: In 2002, Suppiah Dillirajah was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Suppiah had not been seen for five years.

Case reference: 2014005219.CaseDesc: Lori Lee Berens was last seen January 15, 1985 in the Winnipeg area. Lori has not made contact with her family since then and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Often wore a ponytail

Case reference: 2014004614.CaseDesc: Jacob Miller has gone missing in the past, however he has always returned. Mr. Miller was last seen in Winnipeg, MB going for a walk carrying a green backpack and appearing quite disheveled.

Case reference: 2019024246.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2019, Daniel Richards was seen for the last time in the area of Niagara Falls, Ontario. Niagara Police responded to a report of a man that had jumped into the falls. The police were able to obtain a description and a photograph of the man who was identified as Daniel. His vehicle was located abandoned in the nearby area.

Case reference: 2014001643.CaseDesc: On January 10, 1989, Diane Racicot was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. That morning, Diana left a farewell letter in the family home. She left without a change of clothes and with very little money. Diane speaks four languages.

Case reference: 2017073543.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2016, the remains of an unidentified male were discovered in the Niagara River located in Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts this person was of East Asian ancestry.

Case reference: 2014003874.CaseDesc: Marthe Turcotte was last seen in Montreal on September 13, 1971. Her sister dropped her off at the Jean-Talon metro station but she was never seen again. Marthe was a student in Nursing at Thetford CEGEP in Thetford Mines.

Case reference: 2014001017.CaseDesc: On April 10, 1980, the body of an unidentified man was found at the junction of Highways 40 & 540 in Vaudreuil, Quebec. A guitar and harmonica were found with the man and he had five gold fillings.

Boots: Suede, Yellow, With clip as laces
Coat: Blue, White, Chasseur, Plaid blue and white
Nylon, Dark Blue, Anoraque, Orange lining with hood
